Pretty Diff - The difference tool

Examine these samples to see some of the capabilities and potential of the Pretty Diff tool.

Updated: 17 Apr 2012

  1. Diff a minified JavaScript source from Pretty Diff to a duplicate but unminified code source.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://prettydiff.com/prettydiff.js
    • http://prettydiff.com/prettydiff-min.js

  2. Diff complete Node.js v0.6.15 documentation to v0.6.13 documentation. Warning, big execution!!

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.6.15/api/all.html
    • http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.6.13/api/all.html

  3. Diff a JavaScript source from jQuery to obfuscated code. Demonstrates why I dislike obfuscation. Warning, big execution!!

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.7.2.js
    • http://code.jquery.com/jquery-1.7.2.min.js

  4. Diff a minified HTML sample to a similar different minified HTML source.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://prettydiff.com/
    • http://prettydiff.com/prettydiff.com.xhtml

  5. Beautify (pretty-print) the HTML of the Stackoverflow.com homepage as XML.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://stackoverflow.com/

  6. Beautify (pretty-print) the HTML of the W3Schools JavaScript RegExp reference as HTML.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_obj_regexp.asp

  7. Beautify (pretty-print) the HTML of the full Node.js documentation.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.6.15/api/all.html

  8. Minify the HTML of the W3Schools JavaScript RegExp reference as HTML.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://w3schools.com/jsref/jsref_obj_regexp.asp

  9. Minify a large XML Schema with verbose annotations.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://mailmarkup.org/hcl/hcl1_0-documentation.xsd

  10. Minify the HTML of the full Node.js documentation.

    Raw code used for this example:

    • http://nodejs.org/docs/v0.6.15/api/all.html

Please send comments, feedback, and requests to austin.cheney@us.army.mil.

Created by Austin Cheney on 3 Mar 2009. This is a heavy modification of JavaScript tools: jsdifflib, jsmin in JavaScript, cleanCSS and other custom written libraries.
